chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Lewis Williams Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward Lewis Williams Jr. in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Edward Lewis Williams Jr.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Matthew Bughman, Milwaukee Police Department Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Lewis Williams Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Edward Lewis Williams Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for an order to show cause hearing. Defense counsel was recently appointed and a hearing is not needed. Defense counsel requests a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Lewis Williams Jr. in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court will schedule case for Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Edward Lewis Williams in court in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION: Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing event of 8/1/22 added to the record in error. DPA Hearing not held.

Defendant Edward Lewis Williams in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
A preliminary hearing was not completed. Case sent back to preliminary hearing court for a preliminary hearing. Defense reports that defendant no longer wants to continue with the DPA. Case adjounred to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant was ordered to comply with any and all court orders from other court and obey all orders from CPS.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.

Defendant Edward Lewis Williams in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:10 am.
